abstract.text: Your proposed solution for handling a drop in a collection view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Create instances of this class in the

method of your drop delegate object. You create drop proposals to let the collection view know how you intend to handle a drop at the currently specified location. The collection view uses that information to provide appropriate visual feedback to the user.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The interface for initiating drags from a collection view.
An interface for coordinating your custom drop-related actions with the collection view.
The interface for handling drops in a collection view.
Tells your delegate that the position of the dragged data over the collection view changed.
The data associated with an item being dropped into the collection view.
A placeholder for an item dropped on a collection view.
An object that contains information about a placeholder in the collection view.
Your proposed solution for handling a drop in a collection view.
Constants indicating how you intend to handle a drop.
Creates a drop proposal object that specifies how to incorporate the dropped content.
The option to use when incorporating the dropped items into your content.
A placeholder for an item dragged or dropped on a collection view.
An advanced interface for managing a data source object.
Operation types that determine how a drag and drop activity resolves when the user drops a drag item.
A configuration for the behavior of a drop interaction, required if a view accepts drop activities.
Initiate drags and handle drops from a collection view.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Supporting Drag and Drop in Collection Views

abstract.text: A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
